numbered_ace_sentences: 1. I noticed that a legacy applicant is more likely to get into an Ivy League school.
2. I noticed that this is true even if the legacy applicant does not come from a higher-income family.
3. I noticed that many applicants with higher parental income have a significantly lower chance of getting into an Ivy League school if the applicants are not legacy applicants.
4. I wonder whether some legacy applicants with less money get into an Ivy League school because of scholarships.
5. I wonder whether some legacy applicants with less money get into an Ivy League school because of high academic performance.
6. I wonder why a child with higher parental income and with no legacy has a lower chance of getting into an Ivy League school.
7. This topic relates to me and my community.
8. I am a senior in high school.
9. It is interesting to see what colleges look for in an applicant.
10. I wonder whether a college looks at an applicant's amount of money.
11. I wonder whether a college looks at an applicant's academic performance.
12. The headline is: College Applicants: What are they really looking for.
